abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Romania Energy Efficiency Project describes expected
            negative environmental impacts and what measures will be
            used to mitigate them.. They include the following:
            Protecting soil surfaces during construction, control and
            daily cleaning of construction sites, and providing waste
            disposal services will prevent contamination from waste
            materials, particularly asbestos from old insulation.
            Drainage, proper disposal of oil and other hazardous
            materials, and adequate sanitation and disposal system will
            minimize clogged drainage works, a decline in water quality,
            and hazardous wastes. Dust control with water, filters, and
            new insulating materials that avoid containing ozone
            depleting substances will reduce dust during construction,
            emissions of sulfur oxides, nitrogen oxides, particulate
            matter, and other air pollutants. Construction will be
            restricted during certain hours to avoid noise disturbance.
            Alternative sites will be considered to avoid disturbance of
            natural habitats. Minimizing Loss of natural vegetation will
            be minimized and special measures taken to protect sensitive
            wildlife species. Providing solid waste disposal systems and
            cleaning up debris will protect the aesthetics of the
            landscape. Legally enacted special measures will protect
            cultural resources. Preventative measures will reduce
            construction accidents.
